questions.question: Pressure testing is accomplished using two different test mediums, fluid, and gas, and of the two the gaseous test is much safer than using a fluid?
questions.explanation: Pneumatic testing has the potential to explode. They measure this amount of explosion in units of TNT

questions.question: A whip check is used to safely couple hydraulic hoses together.
questions.explanation: Whip checks are used with pneumatic hoses

questions.question: When using an electric hydrostatic pump, it is imperative that you check the electrical rating why?
options: Electrical pumps come is various voltage configurations. They could be 110 volt, 220 volt, or even three phase. To avoid a mishap, the rating plate of the pump should be consulted for the proper configuration.
correctAnswer: Electrical pumps come is various voltage configurations. They could be 110 volt, 220 volt, or even three phase. To avoid a mishap, the rating plate of the pump should be consulted for the proper configuration.

questions.question: What components are required to perform a pressure test?
When performing the test who or what needs to be consulted for the proper execution of the test?
When increasing the test pressure, it should be brought up in stages why?
options: Test pressure needs to be brought up in stages for safety purposes. You need to check for leaks and reduce the damage that may occur as pressures increase.
correctAnswer: Test pressure needs to be brought up in stages for safety purposes. You need to check for leaks and reduce the damage that may occur as pressures increase.

questions.question: When performing a hydrotest, as much air as possible needs to be vented.
questions.explanation: true; We need to eliminate as much air as possible to be able to reach the test pressure and reduce the damage that may occur as pressures increase

questions.question: A six-inch pipe that is 500 ft in length pressurized with air to 150 lbs of pressure holds the equivalent of what force?
What are two of the hazards of pressure testing?
options: Flying objects such as valves, flanges, gauges, and fittings
Flying shrapnel such as small pieces of pipe, pipe fittings or other system components that shatter into parts from the pressure
Oxygen displacement from an inert gas used for testing
Flooding in areas where energized electrical sources are present
Spills or leaks during cold spells can create a hazardous icing condition
correctAnswer: Flying objects such as valves, flanges, gauges, and fittings
Flying shrapnel such as small pieces of pipe, pipe fittings or other system components that shatter into parts from the pressure
Oxygen displacement from an inert gas used for testing
Flooding in areas where energized electrical sources are present
Spills or leaks during cold spells can create a hazardous icing condition

questions.question: What is the purpose of a hydrostatic test on a piping assembly?
options: To comply with the company's quality control requirements and with government safety regulations
To prevent damage to the environment
To ensure that the system can more than adequately carry its design pressure
correctAnswer: To ensure that the system can more than adequately carry its design pressure

questions.question: What is the most popular method of testing piping systems?
Why is it necessary to install spill pans or other collection devices before a hydrostatic test?
options: To prevent losing the water on the ground
To prevent the test crew from getting wet
To save the test fluid for reuse when testing the next assembly

questions.question: What should be the maximum pressure rating for a hose used on the discharge of a pressure test pump?
options: The same as the maximum rated discharge pressure of the pump
At least 1½ times the test pressure
At least 1½ times the pump outlet pressure
Greater than the maximum rated discharge pressure of the pump
correctAnswer: Greater than the maximum rated discharge pressure of the pump

questions.question: What type of pressure gauge is usually used for pressure testing?
What components are used to make up a pressure test harness?
options: Flanges, system isolation valve, pressure bleed valve, recorder connection outlet
Pump shut-off valve, pressure bleed valve, pressure gauge, fill bypass hose connection
Union, pump shut-off valve, pressure bleed valve, pressure gauge, recorder connection outlet
Union, pump shut-off valve, pressure bleed valve, pressure gauge
correctAnswer: Union, pump shut-off valve, pressure bleed valve, pressure gauge, recorder connection outlet

questions.question: What should be done to prevent a universal coupling from coming apart while in use?
options: Push the male end into the female end until the spring-loaded retainer clicks into place.
Install a safety pin across the mating halves of the connectors.
Attach a restraint device to the hose and fasten it to an anchor point.
Tighten the coupling with a couple of pipe wrenches.
correctAnswer: Install a safety pin across the mating halves of the connectors.

questions.question: What determines the maximum output pressure that a 100:1 ratio pneumatic diaphragm pump is capable of producing?
options: Inside diameter of the test hose
Input air pressure to the pump
correctAnswer: Input air pressure to the pump

questions.question: What should the enclosure rating read on an electric motor used to drive a test pump in an area restricted for entry due to the possibility of an explosive or flammable atmosphere?
What gas may be connected to a set of regulators having a CGA-540 connection?
What type of gauge could be used on a line subject to moderate vibration during a hydrostatic test?
What is the primary purpose of a pressure test?
options: To ensure that a component or assembly will not fracture under its maximum rated working pressure
To find major leaks so they can be repaired
To find minor leaks so they can be repaired
To satisfy quality control requirements for a specific job contract
correctAnswer: To ensure that a component or assembly will not fracture under its maximum rated working pressure

questions.question: What is the minimum time required for a hydrostatic leak test according to the ASME B31 codes?
